citation_title: The Distribution of Earnings and Human Wealth in Cycle Context
abstract: The purpose of this paper is to outline a set of conditions under which human wealth is an index of well-being in a life cycle as prefatory to empirical estimates earnings and human wealth distributions for the1960 Census population.
acknowledgement: This research was sponsored by NSF and U.S. Department of Labor grants to the NBER. I have benefited front the conmtents of T. D.Wallace and Pinis Welch. This is not an official NBER publication since it has not been reviewed by the Board of Directors. I want to thank Christy Wilson for drawing the original figures.
